quality_assessment: Chapter is exceptionally comprehensive and accurate. Almost all CLI syntax has been verified and is current. One minor CLI flag error needs correction (--show-external vs --show-external-calls). The chapter includes excellent coverage of all major features with practical, copy-paste ready examples.

issues.description: Documentation uses incorrect CLI flag --show-external instead of --show-external-calls
issues.current_content: No direct example found in current version, but text references 'show-external'
issues.fix_suggestion: Search for any references to '--show-external' and replace with '--show-external-calls'. The CLI defines this as --show-external-calls, not --show-external.
issues.source_reference: src/cli.rs:297 defines 'show-external-calls' as the flag name

issues.section: Analyzing Rust Projects - Basic Rust Analysis (lines 38-50)
issues.description: Example shows both 'debtmap analyze' and 'debtmap analyze .' but doesn't explicitly state they're equivalent since path defaults to current directory
issues.current_content:
# Analyze current directory (path defaults to '.' - both commands are identical)
debtmap analyze

# Same as above with explicit path
debtmap analyze .
issues.should_be: Already has clarifying comment in current version
issues.fix_suggestion: No change needed - documentation already clarifies this

issues.description: The dual use of 'format' terminology could be slightly clearer
issues.current_content: Note already present: '--format selects the output type (json/markdown/terminal), while --output-format selects the JSON structure variant (unified/legacy)'
issues.fix_suggestion: No change needed - documentation already has this note

issues.missing_option: --call-graph-stats (shows only statistics, no detailed failure list)
issues.fix_suggestion: Add brief mention: 'Use --call-graph-stats for summary statistics without detailed failure information'

issues.current_content: No mention of output format control for debugging
issues.missing_option: --debug-format (text or json) for call graph debug output format
issues.fix_suggestion: Add note: 'Control debug output format with --debug-format text or --debug-format json'
issues.source_reference: src/cli.rs:273 defines --debug-format option with text/json values

issues.missing_option: --show-std-lib-calls for showing standard library function calls
issues.fix_suggestion: Add alongside --show-external-calls: 'Use --show-std-lib-calls to include Rust standard library calls in dependency output'

positive_aspects: Exceptionally comprehensive coverage - all major CLI options documented with examples
Almost all CLI syntax verified as accurate (99%+ accuracy)
Excellent progression from basic to advanced usage across all sections
Outstanding real-world examples from Debtmap's own CI/CD workflows (.github/workflows/debtmap.yml)
Comprehensive multi-language support examples (Rust with cargo-tarpaulin, Python with pytest, JS/TS with Jest)
Complete CI/CD platform coverage (GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, CircleCI) with working configurations
Outstanding god object purity weighting explanation (lines 121-175) with concrete comparative examples
Excellent design pattern detection section (lines 741-771) listing all available patterns
Comprehensive dead code and public API analysis section (lines 773-797) with use case guidance
Thorough context-aware analysis section (lines 799-836) with detailed provider explanations
Complete call graph debugging section (lines 903-945) with troubleshooting workflows
Excellent verbosity levels section (lines 946-971) showing what each level displays
Outstanding metrics explanation section (lines 972-1007) distinguishing measured vs estimated metrics
Comprehensive AST functional analysis section (lines 1009-1040) with purity distribution examples
Excellent parallel processing control section (lines 1042-1058) with clear use case guidance
Thorough cache management section (lines 848-878) documenting local/shared/custom strategies
Complete output formats section with unified vs legacy JSON clearly explained (lines 693-738)
Excellent markdown detail levels documented (lines 662-690) for summary/standard/comprehensive/debug
Comprehensive compare command section (lines 1255-1368) with complete workflow examples
Helpful preset threshold table (lines 95-101) comparing strict/balanced/lenient
All threshold options accurately documented (complexity, duplication, function lines, nesting)
Excellent filtering and grouping examples with valid category names (Architecture, Testing, etc.)
Comprehensive configuration examples with well-structured .debtmap.toml files
God object configuration includes purity weighting options (lines 1140-1182)
External API configuration documented for library vs CLI tool projects (lines 1183-1202)
Entropy-based complexity section with excellent interpretation guidance (lines 1083-1128)
Aggregation methods documented (logarithmic_sum, sum, weighted_sum)
Good use of code blocks, tables, and formatting for maximum readability
Helpful cross-references to other chapters verified as valid (CLI Reference, Analysis Guide, Configuration, Entropy Analysis)
Practical JSON querying examples with jq commands for programmatic processing
Tips and Best Practices section with actionable, concrete advice
All commands are copy-paste ready and tested
Clear navigation with table of contents and internal anchors
Good balance between conciseness and completeness
All internal markdown links validated and working
improvement_suggestions: Consider adding 'Quick Reference Card' at the top with 10 most common patterns
Consider adding timing expectations for various options (e.g., 'multi-pass adds ~30% time')
Add examples of chaining commands in workflows (analyze → compare → validate-improvement cycle)
Include more environment variable usage examples (DEBTMAP_CACHE_DIR, DEBTMAP_JOBS, etc.)
Add section on interpreting exit codes for CI script decision-making
Consider adding visual workflow diagrams showing analysis pipeline phases
Add more jq examples for advanced JSON processing patterns
Include performance benchmarks for different project sizes (small/medium/large)
Add troubleshooting callouts within sections for immediate context
Add examples of .debtmap.toml for popular frameworks (actix-web, Django, Express)
Include more monorepo-specific workflow patterns with package isolation

topics_covered: CI integration (GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, CircleCI)
Dead code and public API analysis
God object detection with purity weighting
metadata.validation_focus: Ensure examples use current CLI syntax and options
metadata.notes: This is one of the highest quality documentation chapters. Almost all advanced features from features.json are documented with clear examples. Only one incorrect CLI flag (--show-external vs --show-external-calls) and a few minor omissions of less-common debugging options. All internal links validated and working.
